description: AssemblyAI transcription pipeline: fix API field, retry UI, and conversation viewer with sentiment analysis

changes.description: Researchers can now submit Vapi call recordings to AssemblyAI for high-quality transcription with speaker diarization and sentiment analysis directly from the dashboard. Implemented via two new Supabase Edge Functions (trigger-assemblyai-transcription and assemblyai-webhook) and a local Node.js pipeline script.

AssemblyAI transcription submissions now succeed instead of returning a 400 error for every call. Fixed by correcting the API field from speech_model (singular string) to speech_models (plural array) as required by AssemblyAI's updated API. A new 'Retry errors' button (up to 25 calls) was also added alongside the existing Transcribe button.
changes.details: AssemblyAI's API now requires speech_models as a non-empty array (e.g. ["universal-3-pro"]) rather than a plain string. Both the Edge Function and local script were updated.

changes.description: Researchers can now view a full conversation transcript with speaker-labeled chat bubbles and per-sentence sentiment analysis directly in the response details page. A new 'Transcription' section shows Speaker A and B utterances color-coded, thumbs-up/down sentiment icons per utterance, and a positive/neutral/negative sentiment breakdown bar.
